intro: Turraea hildebrandtii, commonly known as the African yellowwood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, light-colored bark and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Its fruits are three-lobed capsules that release seeds when mature, contributing to its propagation in natural habitats. Turraea hildebrandtii is often found in moist, shaded areas of forests and is valued for its ornamental and ecological significance.
